intro: Logania dentata, commonly known as the toothed logania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and come in shades of pink to red, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Logania dentata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
